title: What can I use this 6% solution of hydrogen peroxide for? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hydrogen peroxide has many uses though the specific use depends on the concentration. As an antiseptic, a 3% concentration is typical so you would have to dilute with sterile water 1:1. However, treating wounds with hydrogen peroxide is no longer recommended. It can damage tissue and slow the process of wound healing. Hydrogen peroxide in the concentration range of 6–10 % is used for bleaching. It will bleach hair, for example. For fun, it is a key ingredient in making elephant toothpaste. Check it out at:

Anything that requires an oxidiser (oxidising agent), I've seen it used in denstrisity as a teeth whitener (I wouldn't suggest doing this yourself), it is also used as a antiseptic or disinfectant, as a beech for hair, my mother told me that it was used to clear my ear when I had glue ear, as a household cleaner and finally as a glass cleaner.
